children.text: The light fitting in the roof cavity has not been installed at least 1800mm up off the platform, and has not been fitted with a guard, which could cause electrocution to someone inside the roof area.
The relevant Australian Standard AS 3000 Electrical Installations states

‘All lampholders shall be located to be adequately protected against damage that might reasonably be expected. In order to protect against inadvertent contact with live parts, low voltage lampholders shall be located to minimize the risk of;
direct contact with live parts of a lampholder when the lamp is removed; and
mechanical damage to the lamp of lampholder.
These requirements may be satisfied by;
installation not less than 1.8m above ground, floor or platform, or
provision of a suitable guard for the lamp and its lampholder, or
the lampholder is incorporated in a luminaire’

The builder must either raise this light fitting up to higher than 1800mm, or if not possible, install a guard or replace the fitting with a suitable alternative that meets the requirements of AS 3000.
